name: Aider

byoLlm.detail: Supports connecting to OpenAI, Anthropic or local models via API keys

mcpSupport.detail: No built-in MCP client; can be extended via external MCP server integrations

customRules.detail: Through the usage of the file `CONVENTIONS.md`

agentsMdSupport.detail: Not native, but can be configured to read these files. Read more: https://aider.chat/docs/usage/conventions.html#always-load-conventions

commandsReusablePrompts.detail: All instructions given via natural language chat

planMode.detail: Has a `/architect` mode but not considered as a `plan` mode.

additionalInfo: Integrates with Git (auto-commits changes with messages); voice input and image context support

name: Amp

cli.detail: Terminal agent and VS Code plugin available

mcpSupport.detail: Uses tool integrations; capable of running compilers, tests, etc. autonomously

customRules.detail: Compatible with AGENTS.md and other standard instruction files

agentsMdSupport.detail: Accepts AGENTS.md for project instructions to guide the agent

planMode.detail: Planning mode is not natively supported. Users can request planning-only behavior by explicitly instructing the model not to write code.

additionalInfo: Agent toolkit includes automated code review and issue integration

name: Antigravity

cli.detail: Provided as a standalone IDE application

byoLlm.detail: Powered by Google's Gemini models

mcpSupport.detail: Supports MCP for connecting to tools and data sources in agent mode

agentsMdSupport.detail: Expects rules via its own .agent/rules files; AGENTS.md must be manually loaded via a rule if needed

subagentsSupport.detail: Single agent executes plan; no parallel subagent concept

additionalInfo: Supports Workflows (predefined multi-step task sequences) and Agent Manager UI

name: AugmentCode

dedicatedIde.detail: Integrates with VS Code, JetBrains, Vim, etc. via extensions

byoLlm.detail: Uses provided model endpoints; no arbitrary model configuration for individual users

mcpSupport.detail: Integrates Model Context Protocol tools for retrieval and actions

planMode.detail: Has a tasklist mode to create step-by-step plans.

additionalInfo: Integrations with Slack/Teams; smart hooks for pre/post command automation

name: Claude Code

cli.detail: Claude Code CLI and interactive terminal mode

dedicatedIde.detail: Available via web interface and editor integrations

ideExtension.detail: While it exists, it seems to be just a terminal inside the IDE

byoLlm.detail: Tied to Anthropic's Claude models

mcpSupport.detail: Native support for MCP to connect tools; e.g. can use Figma plugin via MCP

agentsMdSupport.detail: Uses CLAUDE.md for similar purpose; AGENTS.md is not natively used by Claude Code

agentSkillsSupport.detail: Supports specialized agents and skills through its plugin system

subagentsSupport.detail: Can spawn autonomous sub-agents to handle subtasks

planMode.detail: Plan mode for architectural planning before implementation

additionalInfo: Supports Hooks (automated event-driven scripts) and Plugins to extend with new capabilities

name: Continue
additionalInfo: Provides Mission Control UI to manage agent tasks; cloud agent support for CI/CD

name: Crush

byoLlm.detail: Supports multiple models and multi-model configs

mcpSupport.detail: Built-in support for connecting to MCP servers over stdio/http/SSE

customRules.detail: Creates AGENTS.md on project initialization by default to store context

agentsMdSupport.detail: Uses AGENTS.md as the project context file; can be renamed via config

agentSkillsSupport.detail: Supports the Agent Skills open standard; discovers skills from `skills/` directories with SKILL.md

commandsReusablePrompts.detail: Some special CLI flags and commands, e.g. `--yolo` to bypass confirmations; otherwise natural language in TUI

subagentsSupport.detail: Single agent performs tasks sequentially, though it can orchestrate multi-step workflows internally

additionalInfo: Configurable JSON config (crush.json); .crushignore to exclude files; permission management

name: Cursor

dedicatedIde.detail: Cursor is a standalone VS Code-fork IDE

byoLlm.detail: Bundled with supported model endpoints; no arbitrary model plug-in

mcpSupport.detail: Supports connecting to MCP servers for tools; can configure MCP tools in settings

agentsMdSupport.detail: Treats AGENTS.md as equivalent to its rules format for compatibility

agentSkillsSupport.detail: Not officially released, but in beta: https://cursor.com/docs/context/skills

subagentsSupport.detail: The agent handles tasks in one thread, though it can run background analysis as background agents for suggestions

additionalInfo: VS Code fork IDE; supports background agents for suggestions; Cursor Rules for instructions

name: Factory

cli.detail: Factory CLI to interact with Droids in terminal

dedicatedIde.detail: Integrates into existing editors via plugins; no separate IDE

byoLlm.detail: Read more: https://docs.factory.ai/cli/user-guides/choosing-your-model#5-%C2%B7-bring-your-own-keys-byok

mcpSupport.detail: Extensive tool integrations, effectively using MCP to connect to code, logs, docs, tickets, etc.

agentsMdSupport.detail: Integral to context – supports multiple AGENTS.md for different project parts

additionalInfo: Maintains User and Organization memory; rich third-party integrations (GitHub, Jira, Notion, Datadog)

name: Gemini CLI

cli.detail: Open-source Google Gemini CLI for terminal

dedicatedIde.detail: Though it integrates with VS Code and JetBrains via plugins

byoLlm.detail: Specifically built to use Google's Gemini model via Google's API

mcpSupport.detail: Supports tool use via the Model Context Protocol as part of its agent capabilities

customRules.detail: Supports AGENTS.md and its own GEMINI.md for project instructions

agentsMdSupport.detail: Loads AGENTS.md as custom instructions if present

agentSkillsSupport.detail: Supports Agent Skills – modular skill directories with SKILL.md

commandsReusablePrompts.detail: Allows mode switching and slash-style commands in the CLI; smart actions in IDE UI

subagentsSupport.detail: Focuses on one agent, but extensible via skills rather than multiple concurrent agents

additionalInfo: Provides Smart Actions in IDE; integrates LSP for code context; 1000 free requests/day

name: GitHub Copilot

cli.detail: Copilot CLI available for terminal assistance

dedicatedIde.detail: Integrates into popular IDEs/editors as extension

byoLlm.detail: Supports BYOK for certain models – e.g. enterprise can use own Azure OpenAI key – but generally uses GitHub-provided model endpoints

mcpSupport.detail: Microsoft's Copilot ecosystem supports MCP to connect to internal knowledge bases and tools

customRules.detail: Supports custom instructions at user and repo level

agentsMdSupport.detail: Reads AGENTS.md files in the repo for project-specific guidance

agentSkillsSupport.detail: Supports Agent Skills which are modular capabilities for the Copilot agent

commandsReusablePrompts.detail: Supports reusable prompts via `.github/copilot-instructions.md`; also offers CLI slash commands for common tasks

subagentsSupport.detail: Copilot uses a single agent; no concurrent subagent feature exposed

additionalInfo: Supports BYOK for enterprise; memory features to retain context across sessions

name: Goose

dedicatedIde.detail: But provides a desktop GUI option in addition to terminal

byoLlm.detail: Works with any LLM; supports multi-model configurations

mcpSupport.detail: Designed to integrate with MCP servers; can seamlessly use external tools

agentsMdSupport.detail: Uses AGENTS.md for project context if present

additionalInfo: Offers Recipes (YAML scripts for multi-step workflows); supports Agent Client Protocol

name: Jules

cli.detail: Jules Tools CLI to interface with the cloud agent

dedicatedIde.detail: Runs asynchronously in cloud; not inside your editor

byoLlm.detail: Powered by Google's models on their backend

subagentsSupport.detail: Jules itself is a single agent per task, operating asynchronously

additionalInfo: Works via GitHub integration; operates asynchronously in secure cloud sandbox

name: KiloCode

cli.detail: Provides a CLI and also editor extensions

dedicatedIde.detail: Available as VS Code/JetBrains plugins and CLI; no separate IDE app

byoLlm.detail: Model-agnostic: supports OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Gemini, local Llama2, etc.

mcpSupport.detail: Built for tool use; can call compilers, run tests, search documentation via integrated or MCP tools

additionalInfo: Multi-mode context management; Memory Bank (.kilocode/rules directory); forked from Roo Code

name: Kiro

dedicatedIde.detail: Integrates with existing IDEs and also offers CLI; an IDE plugin exists for VS Code as Kiro agents

byoLlm.detail: Uses managed model access, often through Amazon Q or AWS endpoints as Kiro is closely integrated with AWS

mcpSupport.detail: Supports connecting external tools via MCP

additionalInfo: Smart Hooks (pre/post command automation); agent steering configuration; deep code intelligence via LSP

name: Mistral Vibe CLI

cli.detail: Terminal-based Vibe CLI agent from Mistral

dedicatedIde.detail: But supports editor integration via Agent Communication Protocol

byoLlm.detail: Optimized for Mistral's open Devstral 2 models, but can be adapted to others since it's open source

mcpSupport.detail: Devstral models are built to use tools; Vibe CLI can run shell commands and use code exploration tools as part of its workflow

agentsMdSupport.detail: By convention – it will create or update an AGENTS.md with project context on initialization, and respects such files if present

subagentsSupport.detail: Single agent loop with step-by-step planning and execution, though model can internally plan multi-step solutions

additionalInfo: Deep integration with Mistral's Devstral models; supports ACP to interface with GUI editors like Zed

name: OpenAI Codex

subagentsSupport.detail: Not in the sense of Claude sub-agents

additionalInfo: AI code generation model (now succeeded by GitHub Copilot's use of GPT models); API only, not a standalone agent

name: OpenCode

ideExtension.detail: OpenCode integrates with VS Code, Cursor, or any IDE that supports a terminal.

byoLlm.detail: Not tied to any provider; supports OpenAI, Anthropic, local models, etc.

mcpSupport.detail: Supports connecting to MCP servers; exposes configuration for MCP tools

agentsMdSupport.detail: Analyzes and creates AGENTS.md to brief the agent on the project

agentSkillsSupport.detail: Supports Agent Skills; configurable via `agentskills.io` standard and `skills` directories

additionalInfo: Highly extensible via plugins and SDK; supports Agent Client Protocol (ACP); opencode share for git integration

name: RooCode

cli.detail: Primarily a Visual Studio Code extension

byoLlm.detail: Configurable to use different models via API keys

mcpSupport.detail: Supports tool use like running tests/compilers as part of its autonomous workflow

additionalInfo: VS Code extension; marketed as team of AI agents; integrated with GitHub issues/PRs; base for Kilo Code

name: Trae AI

byoLlm.detail: Supports various models; Bytedance's implementation likely allows plugging different backends

additionalInfo: Deep GitHub integration (opens PRs, comments on issues); multi-agent orchestration; from Bytedance

name: Warp

byoLlm.detail: Only for paid plans - Warp's BYOK lets you plug in your own OpenAI, Anthropic, or Google API keys and use those models inside Warp's agent harness.

additionalInfo: GPU-accelerated terminal emulator; AI features for shell command assistance (not a coding agent)

name: Windsurf

cli.detail: Windsurf is a full IDE application, though it has a command palette and can be launched via `windsurf` command

dedicatedIde.detail: Windsurf IDE – a standalone AI-powered editor

byoLlm.detail: This is only available to free and paid individual users. Read more: https://docs.windsurf.com/windsurf/models#bring-your-own-key-byok

mcpSupport.detail: Native MCP integration to extend agent with external tools

agentsMdSupport.detail: Supports reading AGENTS.md files for project instructions

subagentsSupport.detail: One primary agent Cascade per workspace, which handles tasks sequentially

additionalInfo: Supports Cascade Hooks, Worktrees (parallel git worktrees), and visual plugin management; built on Codeium

name: Zed

firstRelease.detail: Initial v0.1 without AI at the time

cli.detail: Zed is a GUI code editor, though it can connect to terminal-based agents via ACP

byoLlm.detail: See: https://zed.dev/docs/ai/configuration

mcpSupport.detail: Via Agent Client Protocol and MCP, Zed can let an agent execute commands and retrieve data; e.g. works with Gemini CLI or Vibe CLI as external agent

agentsMdSupport.detail: Project rule files in Zed can simply be AGENTS.md – it treats them equivalently

agentSkillsSupport.detail: Zed itself doesn't define a skills system, but can leverage any skills the connected agent has

commandsReusablePrompts.detail: Possible to add custom slash commands: https://zed.dev/docs/extensions/slash-commands

additionalInfo: Implements Agent Communication Protocol (ACP); flexible provider setup; multi-buffer editing
